titles.title: Wood-Pawcatuck Watershed Protection Act
Wood-Pawcatuck Watershed Protection Act

A bill to amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate a segment of the Beaver, Chipuxet, Queen, Wood, and Pawcatuck Rivers in the States of Connecticut and Rhode Island for study for potential addition to the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 113-27.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Wyden without amendment. With written report No. 113-60.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 114.

term.name: Wilderness and natural areas, wildlife refuges, wild rivers, habitats

bill.summary: 6/27/2013--Reported to Senate without amendment. Wood-Pawcatuck Watershed Protection Act - Amends the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate for study for potential addition to the national wild and scenic rivers system specified segments of the Beaver, Chipuxet, Queen, Wood, and Pawcatuck Rivers in Rhode Island and Connecticut. Requires submission to Congress of a report describing such study's results.
